text:
**Match Result:** Washington Freedom defeated Los Angeles Knight Riders by 8 wickets in the 2024 MLC tournament on Sunday.

**Key Performances:**

* Saurabh Netravalkar took 4 wickets for 35 runs, and Glenn Maxwell took 3 wickets for 15 runs to restrict Los Angeles to 129.
* Travis Head scored 54 runs, and Steve Smith scored 42* to guide Washington to a comfortable victory.
* The opening pair of Head and Smith shared a 79-run partnership, laying the foundation for Washington's win.

**Notable Incident:** Andre Russell's short-pitched delivery broke Travis Head's bat, with the ball smashing the upper-half of the bat and flying towards mid-wicket, leaving Head shocked and the incident going viral on social media.

**Upcoming Matches:** Washington Freedom will face MI New York on Tuesday in Dallas, while Los Angeles Knight Riders will take on Seattle Orcas on Wednesday in Morrisville.

**Match Details:**

* Teams: Washington Freedom and MI New York
* Date: Tuesday, July 16, 2024
* Time: 8:30 p.m. ET
* TV Channel: YES Network
* Venue: Not specified (one of two venues: Grand Prairie Stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas, or Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina)

**Standings:**

* Washington Freedom: 1st place with a 3-0 record
* MI New York: 4th place with a 1-2 record

**League Information:**

* Major League Cricket is a six-team T20 cricket league that started in 2023
* The entire league season takes place in July
* The league aims to build momentum after the United States hosted the T20 World Cup this year

In Match 13 of the MLC 2024 at Church Street Park, Morrisville, a scary incident occurred when Seattle Orcas' opener Ryan Rickelton hit a powerful shot that hit San Francisco Unicorns' pacer Carmi le Roux on the head, leaving him seriously hurt. Le Roux, a 31-year-old South African-born USA player, was attended to by Rickelton, his partner Shehan Jayasuriya, and the Unicorns players before being helped off the field by the physio.

**Match Details:**
Match 15 of the Major League Cricket tournament will be played between LA Knight Riders and Seattle Orcas on July 17th at Church Street Park, Morrisville.

**Points Table:**
Seattle Orcas are currently at the bottom of the points table with 1 win and 3 losses, while LA Knight Riders are at 4th position with 1 win and 3 losses.

* LA Knight Riders: Lost their previous match against Washington Freedom by 8 wickets. Jason Roy is their top run scorer with 109 runs, and Spencer Johnson is their top wicket taker with 7 scalps.

**Squads:**
The squads for both teams are listed in the article, including players like Andre Russell, Sunil Narine, and Jason Roy for LA Knight Riders, and Quinton de Kock, Heinrich Klaasen, and Shehan Jayasuriya for Seattle Orcas.

**Predictions:**
The article predicts that Seattle Orcas will win the toss, and the match will be won by Seattle Orcas. Other predictions include Shehan Jayasuriya and Nitish Kumar as top batters, Imad Wasim and Sunil Narine as top bowlers, and Heinrich Klaasen as the player of the match.

Match 15 of the 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket was played between Los Angeles Knight Riders and Seattle Orcas at Church Street Park, Morrisville, USA. The Seattle Orcas won the toss and elected to bat, setting a target of 142/6 in 20 overs. Ryan Rickelton's 52-ball 89 was the highlight of their innings. In response, the Los Angeles Knight Riders chased down the target with 5 balls to spare, thanks to Unmukt Chand's half-century (62 off 38 balls). They won the match by 4 wickets, with Saif Badar remaining not out on 18. Harmeet Singh and Cameron Gannon were the pick of the Seattle Orcas' bowlers, taking 2 wickets each.

**Match Result:** Los Angeles Knight Riders defeated Seattle Orcas by four wickets in the 15th match of the Major League Cricket at Church Street Park, Morrisville.

**Key Performances:**

* Unmukt Chand scored a crucial 62 for Los Angeles Knight Riders to ensure their victory.
* Ryan Rickelton scored 89 off 52 balls for Seattle Orcas, but his effort went in vain.

**Match Highlights:**

* Los Angeles Knight Riders chased down a target of 143 with five balls to spare.
* Unmukt Chand and Jason Roy built a crucial partnership for the Knight Riders.

* Ryan Rickelton's 52-ball knock was the highlight of Seattle Orcas' innings, but he lacked support from other batsmen.

* The match was between San Francisco Unicorns and Seattle Orcas in the Major League Cricket 2024 tournament.

* The article reports on a match between Washington Freedom and MI New York in the Major League Cricket 2024 tournament.
* Kiwi opener Rachin Ravindra played a notable innings, smashing a brilliant six down the ground and scoring 31 runs from 14 balls.
* His innings helped Washington Freedom put up a score of 182/5, which ultimately led to their 94-run win over MI New York.

* The 13th match of MLC 2024 was played between San Francisco Unicorns (SFU) and Seattle Orcas (SOR) at Church Street Park.
* SFU's Pakistani fast bowler Haris Rauf was surprised by SOR's Shehan Jayasuriya's daring reverse scoop shot, which went for a boundary.
* Despite being expensive, conceding 30 runs in 4 overs, Rauf's SFU won the match by 23 runs.
* Jayasuriya top-scored for SOR with 54 runs from 37 deliveries, including 7 fours and 2 sixes, but his team lost their fourth match in the tournament.

**Team Standings:** Los Angeles Knight Riders are currently in 4th place with 3 points, having won 1 and lost 3 out of 5 games, while Seattle Orcas are in last place with 2 points, having won 1 and lost 3 out of 4 games.

* The 13th match of MLC 2024 was played between San Francisco Unicorns and Seattle Orcas.
* San Francisco Unicorns won the match by 23 runs, with Liam Plunkett being named the Player of the Match for his bowling figure of 3/26 in four overs.
* During the third over of Seattle's innings, a horrific incident occurred when Carmi le Roux, a South African pacer, was hit on the head by a ball and left bloodied. He was forced off the field and replaced by Corey Anderson to complete the over.
* San Francisco Unicorns scored 166 runs in their innings, thanks to Matthew Short's half-century and Finn Allen's 34 off 18. Cameroon Gannon picked up three wickets and Imad Wasim got two for the Orcas.
* In response, Seattle Orcas had a good start with Ryan Rickleton (29 off 21) and Shehan Jayasuriya (54 off 37) combining for a 76-run stand, but they lost four wickets in the next five overs and eventually fell short of the target by 23 runs.
* As a result, San Francisco Unicorns moved up to the third spot in the MLC 2024 standings, while Seattle Orcas remain at the bottom.

In a recent MLC 2024 match, Washington Freedom defeated MI New York by 94 runs, securing their spot in the playoffs. The match was highlighted by Rachin Ravindra's brilliant innings, where he scored 31 runs off 14 balls, including two sixes, reminiscent of Brendon McCullum's style. Washington Freedom posted a total of 182/5, led by half-centuries from Tim Head and Andries Gous, and an impactful bowling spell from Jasdeep Singh. MI New York was dismissed for 88 runs, resulting in a comprehensive victory for Washington Freedom. This win propelled Washington Freedom to the top of the points table.

**Match Result:** San Francisco Unicorns (SFU) won the 13th match of MLC 2024 against Seattle Orcas (SOR) by 23 runs at Church Street Park in Morrisville.

**Key Performances:**

* Shehan Jayasuriya of Seattle Orcas scored 54 runs off 37 deliveries, including 7 fours and 2 sixes, before being dismissed by Pat Cummins.
* Sanjay Krishnamurthi of San Francisco Unicorns played a quick cameo of 30 runs off 21 balls.
* Pat Cummins, the Australian captain and pacer, took a wicket in the match.

**Notable Moment:** Shehan Jayasuriya played an incredible reverse scoop shot off Haris Rauf's delivery, leaving the Pakistan pacer stunned and angry.

**Post-Match Quotes:**

* Corey Anderson, captain of San Francisco Unicorns, praised his team's efforts and Sanjay Krishnamurthi's performance, and expressed his satisfaction with the win.
* Anderson also appreciated the presence of Pat Cummins in the team, saying it calms the group and adds balance to the team.

**Match Update**: San Francisco Unicorns defeated Seattle Orcas by 23 runs in a match held at Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina on July 17th.

**Injury Incident**: Carmi le Roux, the South Africa-born pacer, suffered a nasty blow to the face while bowling to Ryan Rickelton in the 4th ball of the second over. He was replaced by skipper Corey Anderson and didn't return to the field.

**Match Performance**: Liam Plunkett was the top performer with figures of 3/26, while Matthew Short, Corey Anderson, and Pat Cummins picked one wicket each. San Francisco Unicorns restricted Seattle Orcas to 142/6 and won the game.

**Batting Performance**: Shehan Jayasuriya was the top scorer for Seattle Orcas with 54 runs off 37 balls, while Ryan Rickelton scored 29 runs.

**Post-Match Reaction**: San Francisco Unicorns skipper Corey Anderson praised the team's effort, especially mentioning Krishnamurthi and Pat Cummins for their performances. He expressed hope to build momentum from this win.

**Match Result:** Washington Freedom defeated MI New York by 94 runs in their fifth match of Major League Cricket 2024 at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas.

**Top Performers:**

* Travis Head (Washington Freedom): 54 off 33 balls with 9 fours and 2 sixes
* Andries Gous (Washington Freedom): 59 off 48 balls with a half-century
* Rachin Ravindra (Washington Freedom): 31 off 14 balls with 2 sixes and a four
* Jasdeep Singh (Washington Freedom): 3/14 in 3 overs
* Glen Maxwell (Washington Freedom): 2 wickets in an over, including Boult and Ehsan Adil

**Key Moments:**

* Washington Freedom posted a formidable total of 182/5 in 20 overs, thanks to half-centuries from Travis Head and Andries Gous.
* MI New York struggled in their chase, losing 5 wickets within the Powerplay and eventually being bowled out for 88 runs.
* Washington Freedom's bowlers, including Jasdeep Singh and Glen Maxwell, delivered an exceptional performance to secure the win.

**Tournament Implications:**

* Washington Freedom became the first team to qualify for the Playoffs this season, solidifying their lead at the top of the points table with 9 points from 5 matches.

Saurabh Netravalkar, a left-arm pacer, has already taken 12 wickets in just four games of the current MLC season, with an impressive average of 9.16 runs per wicket and a strike rate of 7.66. This surpasses his tally of 10 wickets in the entire previous campaign. Netravalkar's form has carried over from his successful T20 World Cup 2024 campaign, where he was the top wicket-taker for the United States. Compared to last year's MLC season, Netravalkar's average wickets per match has increased from 1.67 to 3, and his economy has improved from 7.28 runs an over to 7.17. His performance will be crucial for his team's success in the upcoming matches.

The article discusses the impact of Major League Cricket in the United States, particularly in Morrisville, North Carolina. Two guests, Mark Stolman, former mayor of Morrisville, and Steve Rao, Morrisville Town Councilman, share their insights on the history, growth, and future of cricket in the region. They highlight Morrisville's significance as a key location for international cricket events and the importance of Church Street Park. Additionally, they discuss the potential for a North Carolina-based Major League Cricket team in the future.

**Other Information**

* The Major League Cricket was established in 2019 by American Cricket Enterprises (ACE) to promote cricket in the United States.
* The league aims to feature high-profile players and teams, with the inaugural season taking place in 2023 and MI New York emerging as the champions.

**League Information:**

* Major League Cricket (MLC) is a professional Twenty20 cricket championship in the United States, launched in 2023.
* It is exclusively sanctioned by USA Cricket and features superstars from around the world.
* The league has six teams, representing different cities and regions in the United States.

**Teams:**

* The teams in MLC are: Texas Super Kings, Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, and Washington Freedom.
* The Texas Super Kings team is led by Faf du Plessis and includes players like Devon Conway, Marcus Stoinis, Naveen Ul Haq, and Milind Kumar.

**Schedule and Venues:**

* The matches will take place at Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium in Texas and Church Street Park in North Carolina.
* The full schedule and available tickets can be viewed on the MLC website.

**Previous Season:**

* MI New York won the inaugural MLC season in 2023 by defeating the Seattle Orcas.

**T20 Cricket Format:**

* T20 cricket is a shortened format of cricket, lasting approximately 3 hours.
* Each team has 20 overs (120 balls) to score the most runs.
* The format is known for explosive hitting and taking risks to hit big sixes.

**Rules:**

* Each team consists of 11 batters who try to score more runs than their opponent.
* The fielding team attempts to retire all batters as quickly as possible to keep the run count low.
* A team earns one run when a batsman hits the ball and runs from one set of stumps to the other.
* Teams earn four runs for hitting the ball out of bounds and six runs for hitting the ball out of bounds without it touching the ground.

**Impact on Cricket in the US:**

* MLC has revolutionized the cricket landscape in the US, achieving List-A status and recognition as an official T20 league by the ICC.
* The inaugural 2023 season was a huge success, with sold-out matches drawing millions of viewers worldwide.

**Match Result:** Washington Freedom defeated MI New York in a Major League Cricket match.
